subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] how do we promote a phonemic/phonetic writing sytem for english
msgSnippet: ... I would prefer Esperanto also as its adoption would make it possible for people everywhere to learn one extra language past their birth tongue to
messageBody:
satnordameriko wrote:


> [snip]
>
>
> if english is going to the defacto lingua franca (I would prefer
> something like Esperanto instead given it's simplicity),

I would prefer Esperanto also as its adoption would make it possible for
people everywhere to learn one extra language past their birth tongue to
communicate. Unfortunately, logic has little to do with what happens in
the world or how people respond to issues. English seems to be well on
its way to becoming a lingua anglica (?) whether the rest of the world
likes it or not. It would be helpful if the alphabet in which it is
written could aid people in learning it rather than hindering them.

Paige G.
